contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox person | name = Carl Otto Mörner | image = Carl Otto Mörner (from Hildebrand, Sveriges historia).jpg | birth_date = 22 May 1781 | image_size = 200px | caption = Carl Otto Mörner (from Hildebrand, Sveriges historia) | birth_place = | death_date = 17 August 1868 | death_place = | religion = | occupation = courtier and member of the [[Parliament of Sweden|Diet]] | spouse = | parents = | children = }} Baron '''Carl Otto Mörner''' (22 May 1781 - 17 August 1868) was a [[Sweden|Swedish]] courtier, and member of the Diet, advocated for Jean Baptiste Bernadotte's (future [[Charles XIV of Sweden]]) succession to the Swedish crown in 1810.<ref>[http://books.google.com/books?id=pIW1TGqG_YQC&pg=PA33&lpg=PA33&dq=baron+morner+stockholm&source=bl&ots=KXMc4Fk8LV&sig=o5djyrZD5idKpee-w8y_hgHvupE&hl=en&ei=kP2ETKPwKo7Jswb9wqWaBQ&sa=X&oi=book_result&ct=result&resnum=1&ved=0CBIQ6AEwAA#v=onepage&q=baron%20morner%20stockholm&f=false The History of Napoleon the First], by Pierre Lanfrey, BiblioBazaar, LLC, 2009 - 182 pages</ref> Baron Mörner is a character in [[Désirée (film)|Désirée]], a 1954 historical film biography. The film tells a fictionalized story of [[Désirée Clary]], spouse of [[Charles XIV of Sweden]], and her relationship with [[Napoleon]]. ==References== {{Reflist}} {{Authority control|VIAF=50102378}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Morner, Carl Otto | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = 22 May 1781 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = 1869 | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Morner, Carl Otto}} [[Category:1781 births]] [[Category:1869 deaths]] [[Category:Swedish nobility]] [[Category:19th-century Swedish people]] {{Sweden-bio-stub}} {{Euro-noble-stub}}
